title: Electric drink mixer
marks: \"Oster/REG. U.S. PAT. OFF.\", in black, on front of
text: Electric drink mixers provide an enduring link with 1930's America. Their base and stem are invariably vitreous-enamelled in the ubiquitous Depression green, and they evoke fond memories of the diners and drugstores where they became a mandatory fixture. Their simplified elegance and function (a switch-actuated paddle started as soon as the drink flask was inserted in place), assured fast service and eliminated the need for external controls.
description: light green enameled body with chrome motor and adjatator; steel mixing cup
creditline: Gift of funds from Kathleen Bendel
